title: Japan hit by record high temperatures and significant deficiency in rainfall
description: Despite experiencing summer temperatures considerably higher than the seasonal norms, the Japanese government is exhibiting reluctance in fulfilling its pledge to mitigate its escalating greenhouse gas emissions.

title: Proud Boys leader Enrique Tarrio gets record 22 years in prison for US Capitol assault
description: The sentence for the former leader of the far-right militia for his role in the 2021 attack on the US capital is the stiffest sentence handed out so far.

title: Brazil: Extratropical cyclone kills at least 21 people
description: The extreme weather in the south of the country has displaced more than 3,700 people with more flooding anticipated.

title: Why Zemmour will stand trial again after his comments on Pétain and French Jews
description: France's highest criminal court on Tuesday, September 5 overturned the decision of the Paris Court of Appeals, which had acquitted the far-right polemicist of 'disputing crimes against humanity.'

title: Hong Kong's top court ruling paves way for recognition of same-sex partnerships
description: The court declared that the government must establish a legal framework for recognizing same-sex partnerships, marking a significant milestone for LGBTQ+ rights in the city.

title: France's century-long crusade against religious symbols at school, from the crucifix to the abaya
description: Since the secular school system was introduced in the late 19th century, there have been several laws on religious symbols at school. In the past the focus was on Christian symbols, whereas today the controversy is centered on clothing associated with Islam.

title: After prolonged drought and repeated heat waves in Spain, early torrential rains leave climatologists puzzled
description: After weeks of crushing heat, three people are dead and three others are missing after torrential rainfall, unusual this early in the year.

title: Uniform or 'standard outfit': Details of 'experiment' in French schools to be unveiled in the fall
description: Since Education Minister Gabriel Attal tested the idea at the end of July, many right-leaning lawmakers have expressed interest. Among teachers, the debate is a source of irritation.

title: Bastien Chalureau: how the rugby player's criminal past resurfaced just days before the World Cup
description: The French lock's conviction for racist violence in 2020, which the player has appealed, has interrupted his team's final preparations for their World Cup at home.

title: Spain's football federation fires women's head coach amid ongoing Rubiales' controversy
description: Jorge Vilda had applauded the federation president when he refused to resign despite widespread criticism for kissing player Jenni Hermoso on the lips without her consent.

title: UK's second biggest city latest to declare financial distress
description: Birmingham City Council has declared financial distress and blocked spending on all but essential services, citing cuts of £1 billion by successive Conservative governments since 2010.

title: Israel's political crisis reaches the Supreme Court
description: Challenging how the president of Israel's highest jurisdiction is appointed, one of its judges further upsets an already vulnerable institution.

title: TikTok begins storing European user data in Ireland
description: The Chinese platform announced that operations are underway at the first of its three European data centers, part of its effort to ease Western fears about privacy risks.

title: French government's anti-smoking initiative stirs debate
description: The ban on disposable vapes announced by Prime Minister Elisabeth Borne on Sunday is welcomed by anti-smoking associations. They are however disappointed by the absence of a further targeted tax increase on tobacco.

title: War in Ukraine: Cluster munitions mainly kill civilians, reports Human Rights Watch
description: Despite being outlawed in many countries, cluster munition attacks are being used not only by the Russians but also, to a lesser extent, by the Ukrainians.

title: France begins talks on withdrawal of some of its troops from Niger
description: Sources told Le Monde discussions are now taking place about withdrawing units from Niger. Until now, France had rejected the idea of removing any of its soldiers.

title: How France was driven out of the Sahel
description: After coups in Mali and Burkina Faso, the latest putsch, in Niger, has forced France to examine what lingering influence it has in the region, as its former colonies reject its legacy.

title: Draft declaration of African Climate Summit attracts criticism
description: The document proposed by Kenya, intended to define a common position among the 54 countries involved in climate negotiations, has given rise to numerous disagreements.

title: The Elite Tennis Center in Cannes welcomes Russian players
description: The private structure, home to a number of Russian players and the recently naturalized French No. 2, Varvara Gracheva, was long the training base for Daniil Medvedev, winner of the 2021 US Open.

title: How Macron is making education his exclusive domain
description: As a new school year begins, the French president has been highly vocal on education. On Monday, he clarified his position on banning the abaya or the wearing of uniforms.

title: Dozens of UK schools at risk of collapse
description: The British government is facing a new scandal, this time over dilapidated public buildings. The public increasingly feel that the country 'is broken.'

title: Esther Duflo: 'The fight against global warming is 20 years behind the fight against poverty'
description: Esther Duflo, winner of the 2019 Nobel Prize in Economics, has published a series of 10 children's books with illustrator Cheyenne Olivier.

title: Swedish diplomat jailed in Iran
description: The identity of the young man, detained since April 2022, had been kept secret by Stockholm and Brussels.

title: As government returns from summer break, Macron's agenda on climate still unclear
description: After being upstaged by riots at the end of June, environmental planning was barely mentioned during a meeting between the French president and party leaders.

title: US Open: Alcaraz dominates as upsets shake women's draw
description: The young Spanish sensation surged into the last eight as defending champion defending champion Iga Swiatek was sent packing.

title: Paris court looks to lift final mysteries surrounding criminal's helicopter escape
description: The armed robber Rédoine Faïd, a repeat offender serving several sentences, escaped from prison in July 2018 with the help of three hooded men and a chopper from the 1950s. One of his accomplices is still wanted.

title: 'Charlie Hebdo' denounces proposed Danish blasphemy law
description: The French satirical weekly magazine along with several Scandinavian media outlets are protesting the return of the 334-year-old provision, denouncing it as a regressive move influenced by authoritarian regimes and a threat to freedom of expression.

title: Gabon: General Oligui Nguema takes power and promises democracy
description: The new transitional president was sworn in on Monday in Libreville. While he promised to lead his country to 'free and transparent' elections, he did not commit to a specific date.

title: Burning Man festival-goers begin mass exodus
description: The counterculture festival's 70,000-plus attendees had been stranded since torrential rains came down Friday night and Saturday, turning the venue into a quagmire.

title: Invasive alien species: A global threat to biodiversity
description: In a report published on Monday, the Intergovernmental Science-Policy Platform on Biodiversity and Ecosystem Services proposes solutions to the challenge of invasive alien species, which play a 'major role' in 60% of animal and plant extinctions.

title: Swedish oil executives face landmark trial for alleged complicity in Sudanese war crimes
description: Two former executives of Lundin Oil company go on trial on Tuesday, September 5, for crimes committed in southern Sudan between 1999 and 2003 in connection with their company's activities.
